programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Boston downed Orlando in two of their three meetings in 2023-24, including the final matchup on Dec. 17, 2023, 114-97, behind Jaylen Brown's 36 points and 6 assists; the Magic's Paolo Banchero posted 36 points and 10 rebounds for the loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Memphis claimed wins over San Antonio in their first three meetings of the 2023-24 season before suffering a 102-87 defeat in the final matchup on Apr. 9; Victor Wembanyama posted 18 points and 7 rebounds for the Spurs in the away victory.

programme.title: NFL Playoffs
programme.desc: Houston (11-7) picked off Justin Herbert four times in a 32-12 win over the Chargers in the Wild Card Round; Kansas City (15-2), the two-time defending Super Bowl champion, has won eight of the past 10 meetings, including a 27-19 victory in Week 16.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 4 Alabama (14-3, 3-1) had its eight-game win streak snapped by No. 21 Ole Miss, 74-64, despite Mark Sears, who is second in the SEC with 18.6 ppg; No. 8 Kentucky (14-3, 3-1) is 11-0 at home, and won three of the last four meetings.

programme.desc: Arizona (11-5, 5-0) won seven-straight games after an 81-70 win over No. 25 Baylor behind 19 points from Henri Veesaar; Texas Tech (12-4, 3-2) is 8-2 at home this season behind JT Toppin, who is fourth in the Big 12 in scoring with 16.3 ppg.

programme.desc: No. 21 Ole Miss (15-2, 4-0) won four straight after a 74-64 win over No. 4 Alabama; No. 15 Mississippi State (14-3, 2-2) is 7-1 at home behind Josh Hubbard, and won four of its last five vs. the Rebels, including an 83-71 home win last season.

programme.desc: A documentary detailing fascinating stories from the annals of NASCAR history, including exclusive interviews, rare footage and little-known facts about drivers and races that have made NASCAR unique on the American sports landscape.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (11-6, 4-2) has won seven of the nine all-time meetings with the Huskies, including an 85-66 victory on Feb. 20, as Greg McDermott won his 600th career victory as a head coach; No. 14 UConn (13-4, 2-1) has won its last 28 games at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: St. John's (15-3, 6-1) won four-straight behind RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East with 17.5 ppg, and beat the Pirates, 91-74 in the 2024 Big East Tournament after losing the previous four; Seton Hall (6-11, 1-5) lost seven of its last eight.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Grand Rapids claimed a 3-2 victory over Atlanta in the PVF semifinals round on May 15, led by a season-high 54 assists from setter Ashley Evans; outside hitter Claire Chaussee finished with 22 kills from 62 attempts in the postseason win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Xavier (11-7, 3-4) won two straight after losing five of the previous six; No. 7 Marquette (15-2, 6-0) won six-straight games, including a 72-70 win over the Musketeers on Dec. 21 behind Kam Jones, who is second in the Big East with 19.6 ppg.

programme.title: Inside the Big East
programme.desc: Insiders and journalists provide a detailed look inside all the action around the Big East, including highlights from the biggest games, discussions on relevant sports topics, previews of upcoming matchups, player profiles, and much more.

programme.title: The Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show
programme.desc: The FOX Sports team shares coverage of the 2021 Westminster Kennel Club Dog Show as the canine competitors and their owners hope to be crowned the top spot in their respective classes before the coveted Best in Show award is given.

programme.title: Bassmasters
programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Media personalities offer their views and opinions on the day's most intriguing storylines across the world of sports, including debates on the latest issues, analysis of player performances, and discussions on game results and other news.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa State and West Virginia split wins in their two meetings from the 2023-24 season, with the Mountaineers claiming an 84-78 victory in the final matchup on Jan. 27; JJ Quinerly posted 31 points and 6 rebounds for West Virginia in the home win.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 8 Penn State won its last five meetings with the Mountaineers after a 38-15 win last season behind 325 passing yards and three TDs from Drew Allar, two to KeAndre Lambert-Smith; West Virginia went 9-4 in 2023, its best finish since 2016.

programme.title: 89 Blocks
programme.desc: The players for the East St. Louis High School Flyers football team face exceptional challenges and inspiring triumph during the 2016 season, which helped bring some sense of pride and joy to the complicated, at-risk community in Illinois.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Michigan (6-5, 4-4) is 0-3 on the road this season, but won its last three meetings with the Buckeyes after a 30-24 win last season; No. 2 Ohio State (10-1, 7-1) is 7-0 at home this season, and leads the nation in scoring defense, allowing 10.7 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: Breakfast Ball
programme.desc: Craig Carton, a newly inducted member of the New York State Broadcasters Hall of Fame, joins Chicago sports radio personality Danny Parkins and FOX NFL game analyst Mark Schlereth to discuss the most enticing stories in sports each weekday morning.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Iowa (12-5, 3-3) is 0-3 on the road, but is tied for the top scoring offense in the country, averaging 89.5 ppg behind Payton Sandfort and Owen Freeman; UCLA (11-6, 2-4) dropped four-straight games, but is 8-1 at home behind Tyler Bilodeau.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Indiana (13-5, 4-3) dropped its last two games, but won its last three meetings with the Buckeyes after a 76-73 road win last season; Ohio State (10-7, 2-4) lost three of its last four, but is 7-3 at home this season behind Bruce Thornton.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Providence (9-9, 3-4) had its two-game win streak snapped by Creighton, 84-64; Villanova (11-7, 4-3) is 9-1 at home behind Eric Dixon, who leads the country in scoring with 24.8 ppg, and won both meetings with the Friars last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Boise State (13-5, 5-2) split its last four games, but won seven of the last nine meetings; New Mexico (14-4, 6-1) had its seven-game winning streak ended by San Jose State, 71-70, despite Donovan Dent, who leads Mountain West scoring with 19 ppg.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The U.S. Open is often is regarded as one of the most challenging events in bowling, featuring 108 players competing in demanding playing conditions to determine the finalists and winner of the coveted green jacket; E.J. Tackett won title last year.

programme.title: The American Rodeo
programme.desc: The American Contender Tournament offers qualifying rounds across eight rodeo disciplines: Tie-Down Roping, Steer Wrestling, Saddle Bronc Riding, Bareback Riding, Barrel Racing, Break Away Roping, Team Roping and Bull Riding.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The four remaining players compete in stepladder to determine a winner; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas, a five-time major winner on the PBA Tour, defeated five-year PBA Tour pro Michael Martell of Brooklyn, NY, 243-222, in last year's edition.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed a 2-0 win over Al-Taawoun in the Saudi Super Cup before Al-Taawoun managed a 1-0 win over Al-Nassr in the King's Cup round of 16 on Oct. 29; Waleed Al-Ahmed found the net for the lone goal of the match in the 72nd minute of play.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: World Series of Bowling brings you the PBA World Championship; Competitors in the tournament include the top 50 2021 PBA Tour point leaders, PBA Tour title holders, 20 international invitees with 15 invited directly by PBA.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: Over 300 dogs compete in two qualifying rounds consisting of a Standard Agility and a Jumper with Weaves course, with the 10 dogs with the highest combined scores from each of the five height classes advancing; Truant, a Border Collie, won last year.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Each bowler in the eight-player field will have two minutes to throw as many strikes as possible with the player with the most strikes advancing to the next round; Akron's Chris Via, the No. 1 seed, is the defending champion; winner receives $30,000.

programme.desc: A major event in the 2024 PBA National Tour; Brad Miller earned the No. 1 seed, followed by EJ Tackett, Matthew Ogle and Marshall Kent, who will be joined by the winner of the Rounds 1-3, 17-player stepladder finals.
